definition: to become cooler/to lower the temperature/cooling/(of interest, activity etc) to decline
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]
to prevent heatstroke and reduce temperature

sentences.english: At cooling phase, the LITS remains constant.
sentences.chinese: 在降温阶段，LITS却保持不变。

sentences.english: China has long been led by exports and investment-driven economic boom has cooled.
sentences.chinese: 中国长期以来由出口和投资拉动的经济热潮已经降温。

sentences.english: Warm-ups and cool-downs generally involve doing your activity at a slower pace and reduced intensity.
sentences.chinese: 热身和降温通常是以较慢的步伐和强度来锻炼。

sentences.english: Bolin children to eat new to the virus, but also cool.
sentences.chinese: 吃宝宝新博林，去病毒，还降温。

sentences.english: The need of high-gloss injection molding for quick temperature rising and drop cannot be met.
sentences.chinese: 无法满足高光注塑中快速升温及快速降温的需要。

sentences.english: Markets have rallied very fast, but they fell just as quickly in the six months to March.
sentences.chinese: 市场在三月份前的的六个月里乍然回暖又骤然降温。

sentences.english: Holiday travel market cooling, domestic air fares in advance "high platform diving."
sentences.chinese: 假期旅游市场降温，国内机票价格提前“高台跳水”。

sentences.english: After aeration the temperature divergence of each metre grain layer was lower than 1℃.
sentences.chinese: 该系统通风降温效果好，通风后每米粮层温差<1℃。

sentences.english: This kind of treatment is sometimes called hypothermia therapy.
sentences.chinese: 这种治疗有时被称为降温治疗。

sentences.english: They're supposed, there's a cooling happening in both cases.
sentences.chinese: 两种情况下，气体都会降温。

sentences.english: Further, during hot rolling process some amount of fine AlN precipitates at different stages because of strain and decrease in temperature.
sentences.chinese: 而且在热轧过程期间的应变及降温也会使氮化铝析出。

sentences.english: Y: Well, for some people, the natural cooling-off process doesn’t work the way it should.
sentences.chinese: 对有些人来说，这个自然降温的过程无法正常进行。

sentences.english: That's why we're seeing market-cooling measures trickling out of Beijing, the Economist reports
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们看到北京不断出台给房市降温的举措。

sentences.english: And what if the current cooling trend is only brief?
sentences.chinese: 但如果目前的降温趋势只是短暂即逝，又当何论呢？

sentences.english: Check the temperature-pressure relief valve to insure that the valve has not become incrusted with lime.
sentences.chinese: 检查降温减压安全阀是否被石灰堵塞。

sentences.english: Cooling after the air pressure dew point is the minimum to 2 degrees.
sentences.chinese: 经降温后的空气压力露点最低可达2℃。

definition: to become hot/temperature rise/(fig.) to intensify/to hot up/to escalate/to get a boost
to trend/to get popular quickly/sudden heat wave (weather)
